medical_history.chief_complaint: Gradually worsening fatigue and exertional dyspnea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began several weeks prior to the visit, characterized by a feeling of being winded with exercise, particularly when climbing stairs or walking on hills. The patient reported no cough, fevers, chills, chest pain, palpitations, orthopnea, or paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Sjögren’s syndrome, prehypertension, hemorrhoids, allergic rhinitis, migraine headaches.
medical_history.family_history: Grandmother, aunt, and sister had systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
medical_history.social_history: Worked in an office, did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs; lived with his wife and had three healthy adult daughters.
